intro: Zenkerella pauciflora, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and used in traditional medicine. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Zenkerella pauciflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid conditions.
